intro: Mammillaria wohlschlageri, commonly known as the Wohlschlagera mammillaria, is a small, spineless cactus native to Mexico. It features a globular stem covered in dense, white radial spines and a crown of short, woolly hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and slow growth, it is a popular choice among cactus enthusiasts.
